metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3007 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Python Image Library (PIL) 1.1.7 and earlier and Pillow 2.3 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in unspecified vectors related to CVE-2014-1932, possibly JpegImagePlugin.py.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3007` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed at the same time as CVE-2014-1932 and CVE-2014-1933

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3').
